ch.aplu.android.bluetooth

Class BluetoothDiscovery

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.bluetooth.BluetoothDiscovery

  • public class BluetoothDiscovery
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for finding remote Bluetooth devices by an device discovery process.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BluetoothDiscovery(android.app.Activity activity)
      Creates a BluetoothDiscovery instance to perform Bluetooth discovery actions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice discoverBluetoothDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
      If a Bluetooth device is supported and it is enabled, starts the discovery of remote Bluetooth device with given Bluetooth friendly name.
      static android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter getBluetoothAdapter(android.app.Activity activity)
      Returns the default Bluetooth adapter of the given activity.
      android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getPairedDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
      Retrieves the Bluetooth device with given friendly Bluetooth name from the database of paired devices.
      java.util.ArrayList<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getPairedDevices()
      Returns a list of all remote Bluetooth devices that are paired with the local device.
      int startBluetoothDiscovery(BluetoothDiscoveryListener listener)
      If a Bluetooth device is supported and it is enabled, registers the given BluetoothDiscoveryListener and starts the discovery of remote Bluetooth devices.
      void unregisterBroadcastReceiver()
      Unregisters the broadcast receiver used for device discovery.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BluetoothDiscovery

        public BluetoothDiscovery(android.app.Activity activity)
        Creates a BluetoothDiscovery instance to perform Bluetooth discovery actions.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity from where to get the BluetoothAdapter

    • Method Detail

      • startBluetoothDiscovery

        public int startBluetoothDiscovery(BluetoothDiscoveryListener listener)
        If a Bluetooth device is supported and it is enabled, registers the given BluetoothDiscoveryListener and starts the discovery of remote Bluetooth devices. Returns immediately with a information return code.
        Parameters:
        listener - the BluetoothDiscoveryListener that will be notified when Bluetooth devices are detected and when the discovery process is finished
        Returns:
        0, if discovery is successfully started, -1 if Bluetooth is not supported, 1 if Bluetooth device is disabled

      • discoverBluetoothDevice

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice discoverBluetoothDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
        If a Bluetooth device is supported and it is enabled, starts the discovery of remote Bluetooth device with given Bluetooth friendly name. Blocks until the device is found or the discovering is finished. Return a reference to the detected BluetoothDevice or null, if detection failed.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the friedly Bluetooth device name of the device to search for
        Returns:
        a reference to the detected device or null, if detection failed because of no Bluetooth support, device not enabled or remote device not found.

      • getPairedDevices

        public java.util.ArrayList<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getPairedDevices()
        Returns a list of all remote Bluetooth devices that are paired with the local device. To retrieve the Bluetooth friendly name, use BluetoothDevice.getName(), to retrieve the MAC address, use BluetoothDevice.getAddress(). Once the address is known, a connection to the remote device can be engaged without a prior device discovery.
        Returns:
        a list of all paired (bonded) BluetoothDevices

      • getPairedDevice

        public android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice getPairedDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
        Retrieves the Bluetooth device with given friendly Bluetooth name from the database of paired devices.
        Returns:
        the BluetoothDevice with given name; null, if the device is not found in the database of paired (bonded) devices

      • getBluetoothAdapter

        public static android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter getBluetoothAdapter(android.app.Activity activity)
        Returns the default Bluetooth adapter of the given activity.
        Returns:
        the reference to the default BluetoothAdapter; null, if Bluetooth is not supported

      • unregisterBroadcastReceiver

        public void unregisterBroadcastReceiver()
        Unregisters the broadcast receiver used for device discovery.
